reviewText:
Pleasantly surprised by how much fun I'm having.

Forewarning:
Note the casual tag and the price...this game is fun, but don't expect any hardcore depth.  It's more something i've just been playing while watching some YT vids.  Also, I will say I used a 360 controller, the controls both keyboard or controller, I think could use some touch ups.  But at this point I've gotten use to the 360 controller.

Btw, once you get to the best tools, you can chop tree's, or harvest rocks in 1 second.

This game has 2 parts to it.  On one side you're building your village, and crafting new items & buildings, to give you access to more items/buildings.  Take note, I didn't realize this, but some buildings require you to be at a certain level (discussed later).  Basically you have your tools, ranging from axe to sword.  Each level increases dmg down, along with length of time it takes to harvest.  The first time you harvest a tree, you just click once, but it will take a long time.  You have to realize that you don't really want to do much harvesting, let your villagers do that...which they retrieve items from the jobs you've assigned them to on an hourly basis in game (in game hour = 1 min real time).

The other side is a simple dungeon diving exercise.  You'll see a dungeon entrance on your map, you can go down and kill things.  Killing things earns your XP, which earns you levels.  Start out with killing the bunnies and squirrels above ground first, and watch out when you're level 1, those squirrels hurt.  Then aim for armor/sword...to help kill faster.  As you go down further into the dungeon, the levels get larger, monsters get harder.  Save often (not something I really need to say for an rpg, but I said it anyways).  However, as you gain levels, from killing things, check to see if there are new buildings or new tools/weapons to be built.  Some buildings/items can't be built until you're a specific level.

Overall I've really enjoyed playing, and I'm still not done.

reviewText:
*Updated Review*

I ran into a problem that was easily fixed with a reinstall of the game. So I changed my review to a positive review

Your Quest is a pixelated 2D stratergy/survival game. You start out with nothing but wooden tools, and you work to progress your way to better tools and weapons, as well as building and maintaining a successful village of your own creation! It really is Your Quest" because you can build your village like you want it.

As a fan of retro 2D pixelated games like this
date: I find this game to be extremely satisfying in both visuals and mechanics. The movement is a bit slow
recommended: but other than that I think this game is very well made in those aspects.\n\nThere is a simple yet effective crafting system and another simple building system. I'm a huge fan of the way the developer set these up
hoursPlayed:
because they're not confusing in the slightest but they also get the job done well

One thing outside of the game that really impresses me is the developer's interactivity with the community. He listens to suggestions and actually recently fixed a bug pointed out in a steam review.

All and all
voteText: I'd recommend picking this game up. I'm curious to see what's in store in the future."
votesFunny: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Purchase if you like supporting Indie DevelopersThat being said, Your Quest is a good game.  It's  challenging  and time consuming but in a fun way.  Imagine an Idle game mixing with Darksouls, in an RPG village building system.  It reminds me of my old SNES days.

Pros:
the Developer and community respond quickly.  I've seen bugs patched or suggestions implimented the same day they were reported or suggested.
Retro style graphics
Idle game themes
Dungeon crawling
Village Building
Highly modable game,  you can change the graphics, resource requirements, level requirements, create new enemies or items, basically whatever you can imagine!

Cons:
There were bugs early on.  but they have all been fixed.
It can take some time to learn. there is now a tutorial which helps
Once you've beaten the game there isn't much left.  but that takes a while to accomplish and is a true achievement
Overall
$5? absolutely worth it if you understand your not getting a AAA+ rated game like fallout.  It's a simple indie game that I've spent hours enjoying.  Half of my amusement has been communicating with the Dev and community as we all try to make this game even better!  the Developer listens to the community! 10/10 just for that.

reviewText: If you've ever played the browser, text-based game A Dark Room" It's basically that
date:

My only complaint about the gameplay would be that the charm of A Dark Room was that you could set it and let your supplies accumulate while you did other things
recommended: but the slowness of the decorating means you are active the whole time if you want a nice looking village.  It's a good game if you need a mind-numbing
hoursPlayed: theraputic relaxation game that doesn't require much thought or effort
voteText: but you still want the illusion of accomplishment.\n\nEDIT: Now that the "Advanced Equipment" menu has been fixed (in ~24 hours after it was broken by an update) I was able to make better equipment to remove/place tiles much faster meaning the building is not as slow once the game picks up and you have more time to relax."

reviewText:
This is a really good game (I also played 3 or 4 hours of the demo).
The complaints about it are, in my opinion, unfair. It delivers what it promises... a casual, 2D Strategy/RPG.

You gather resources, fight, build, craft... the movement IS slow, but its pretty much in line with similar 2D games. The crafting and harvesting time is slow, but only at first. As you progress and are able to build better and better tools, things change.

I think that may be the root of the negative reviews... people who are used to instant gratification or a pay2win store where they can just purchase the top level gear and bypass having to work your way up in a game

This game is fun. But make no mistake, it is a casual game (perfect for watching videos or having a drink or BOTH).

What really struck me about this game, is the genuine feeling of accomplishment I got when I was finally able to build a new building, or craft a new item. But what really stuck with me was the feeling I got when I finally had a little village going which was basically self sufficient. They were gathering enough resources on their own to support themselves without me needing to add in additional food. It felt good.

On the developer side: wow!

Quick replies and fixes when bugs are reported. I reported a bug and within an hour I had a reply from the developer, and a fix was applied shortly after.


If youre looking for a fun distraction or a really enjoyable time waste (you wont feel like the time was wasted), this game is well worth the $4.99. If you see it on sale for less than that, BUY IT YOU FOOL!!!

Thank me later. Or not at all. We dont even know each other.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: When I first got this game it was frustrating to get used to the controls. But after an hour of playing I realized that the problem wasn't the controls, it was the pace of the game. Since the whole point of the game is to build a village untill your ready to conquer a dungeon, you spend most your time building and gathering resources. But it takes forever to do that, and it shouldn't. I thought after I got workers to collect wood and stone for me, it would be less time consuming to collect enough resources needed to build houses for my village. Wich is true, but it still takes about a minute to put down a damn fence or remove a field, Wich is a problem because when your building or removing something, you can't move. Basically what I'm saying is most the time your staring at your screen as your removing something or building something, and being someone who is used to fast paced gameplay, I find this extremely boring. If your patient and keep an open mind then maybe you will have fun, but I'm done with this game.

reviewText: I don't know if it would be possible to design worse gameplay than this.  You walk -- EXTREMELY slowly -- a few steps and press space to do something.  Then you just sit there watching the screen for 30 seconds while a bar fills up.  Nothing is happening in the game while you do this, it's just frozen while a little bar fills up.  Walk a few more steps, press space again, watch the bar fill up again for another 30 seconds.  Walk a few more steps, press space, watch screen.  WTF?

reviewText:
I know my play time is short but just playing for 30 or 40mins and you can get a very good general idea of what the game is.

I love these types of games, although admittedly i prefer to watch people play them as i personally lose interest in them fast when playing on my own.

Very simple and very easy to pick up and play which is very nice as other types of games like this can become a bit overwelming with the amount of things you have to remember.

I will admit i kept messing up the controlls i dont know why but i kept feeling slightly awkward to me i think mainly because im not used to enter being a main key for a game. THe graphics are very nice but im biased as i love 16bit


Things i like.
The music was very nice, very calming and hihgly enjoyable i would say this game deserves the soundtrack tag
The simplicity was highly refreshing and nicely done
The amount of stuff you will be able to do when the time and dedication is put in caught my interest i will diffinatly be putting in a lot more time on this game.

Things i didnt like.

Honestly right at the start everything was just way too slow. Now i understand that you're meant to be with out tools and everything but when its at the point where you gather things and even move around is so slow you get bored.

I like the idea of presing ctrl to move on the spot but i personally find it redundant and should be somthing that is just implimented in to basic controls


Suggestions to the game creator.

Maybe consider increasing the basic movement speed slightly or give an option to run but only for a short time
Slightly increase the speed of the very early game gathering speed.

I would love to see the creator add multiplayer to this, even somthing as simple and a 2nd player being able to join from pressing start on a controller  I think you will find a lot more people would enjoy th game if they had someone else they could play this with as you would not only progress faster but also not get bored when you have to collect a large ammount of 1 thing (like trees or stone)

Overall i think a lot of the bas reveiws are undeserved as this is a very well dont take on the survival type genre and was very well done at being made 10 times simpler.

6/10
8/10 if multiplayer is added and speed is increased

reviewText: I normally don't go through the trouble to write a review for something but I feel this game is an exception. I posted an issue on the discussions page and I saw it addressed within 24 hours. I really like that I can play this game with my X360 controller. Overall this is a very fun game and a very nice developer to support.\n\nSeveral months later and now I am very angry with the developer. He doesn't listen to the community anymore; he has ceased pretty much all development on the game and the game has tons of bugs. The game runs on XNA which is no longer even existant because it sucked so bad so really my computer meets the requirements but the game launches with a pink screen on my newer computer and I can't get passed it and I am having to use a 10 year old computer that can run the game and my game that I saved is just gone because everytime I try to load it, it just crashes the game so I lost about 36 hours invested into this stupid game. If the developer adds anything more, it probably is just going to be bugs and he doesn't even have people test the game anymore before he releases big updates that may screw up your saved games like it did in my case and make the game unplayable on HUNDREDS of computers. Please do not buy this game.

reviewText:
[4/10] As fun as killing a mammoth with a spoon.

To be honest, I'm not really into this RPG Maker wave of games.
Not that I don't like old school JRPGs ; I was a big fan of Chrono Trigger and Bahamut Lagoon, back in the days ; but they lost their appeal to me, and I don't play much with this type of games anymore.
But today, I was given away this one, YOUR QUEST, and was like Seems nice! Let's try it out!".

So
date: this is a kind of RPG where you play a character lost in a forest and with a quest. Which one
recommended: you ask? Creating a village and protecting it from monsters.\nSimple pitch for a simple game.\nAt the beginning
hoursPlayed: you'll be starting with minimal equipment and a guy named "mentor" who gives you small missions and advices. Soon enough
voteText: you'll be cutting trees
votesHelpful: hunting squirrels and plowing fields...\nNothing very original
votesFunny:
you might say!
So why the bad grade and recommendation?

The first thing that hit me was the music.
Not being a big fan of MIDI tunes doesn't help
commentsCount: but the score of this game is kind of dull and uninspired. A few tracks are  better than the others
column16:
but it gets boring and repetitive real quick.
So I went into the menu and cut it out after thirty-five minutes of gameplay.

The second thing was the lack of animations.
Note that in this game
column17: they are not really of importance. But
column19: it's all very stiff. And slow. Yes. Your character must be the son of a turtle and an snail
column20: cause taking a few steps from its house to the next tree takes him almost one hour of its time. And it can't run.\nTalking about time
column21: I hope you got loads to lose
column22: cause when you go to your house to rest your character
column23: it just idle in front of the house
column25: and the time passes as if you were still playing.\nAfter I had a few villagers and some bread
column26:
I never rested again.

What hit me next was the save system.
6 slots
column29: better remember what was the previous spot
column30:
cause you'll be reloading a few times to find the good savestate. It lacks a log showing you which save is which.

And so I was hit again (my nose started to bleed). This time by the ressource management system.
Why on earth do the same house needs 350 logs when the previous
column33: and so on? Are they playing JENGA with the logs? Making mountains of toothpicks?\nI rapidly found out the answer. It virtually adds some lifespan to the game
column34: which would be quite short if not for this kind of subterfuges.\n\nSo? It's a mobile game concept. It's like playing a fartphone app like "TRIBEZ AND CASTLEZ"
column35:
minus the "pay-to-win" part.
And I don't like this kind of games.
Too repetitive.
Boring.
And pointless."

reviewText:
I'm enjoying the game so far (I'd give it an average score), however I do have some suggestions to vastly improve gameplay:
-Craftable Tools (Allowing for speed up of recource gathering).
-Weapon Textures during battle to have a visualization of what you have accomplished in crafting.
-Plantable saplings to regrow trees (I haven't yet run out of trees, but the ability to regrow trees would be awesome for Decoratvie purposes)
-Tameable creatures; Creatures you tame in order to battle with/for you.
-Visible vilage population, as the village looks deserted dispite having villagers working for you.

I can say that I am happy about modding potential of the game also.

reviewText:
Played 10+ hours (offline steam). Great game. Enjoyable. a bit repeatable and boring, and slow at first. End-game is very fast on the other hand.

Soundtrack: 9/10 [i totally loved it. Very immersive]
Gameplay: 6/10 [Slow at first. Has great potential for more content.]
Graphics: 8/10 [Verily well done pixel art graphics. I wish they added item sprites additionally]
GUI: 5/10 [On one hand you have everything, on other, too much. Played on 1366x768 resolution. at end-game some options were out of visible range and i couldn't chose them (?)]
Controller Support: 10/10 [used xbox360 controller. Very enjoyable, easy, at first a bit hard to remember some functions binded to buttons, everything is explained though]
Extra: -3 for bugs. Game crashed a LOT of times, mostly in dungeons, had to save every few enemies so i didn't lose progress. after finishing game, there was screen you won"
recommended: and couldn't do anything. Sometimes when fighting enemy
hoursPlayed: the game glitched and other enemies were moving
voteText: able to attack you despite being already in fight with the first enemy (weird glitch).\n\nSummary: 35/50 worth buying on discounts. I got it for free. Probably won't have bought it ever. Game is much more fun than what you can see on video/pictures."
